host.host_about: I travel a lot and happy to share my space with someone while I'm traveling. I'm very optimistic, friendly and love to stay at the local places when I'm traveling.

reviews.comments:
The place was exactly what I looked for my stay and was great for my business trip.

Location is great. It's a few blocks from 23rd Street train station, which is convinient as you can take E train directly from JFK without transfers. Other metro stations are in walking distance as well. Super close to High Line and in very nice street block in Chelsea, very quiet which is not usuall for the busy NY. Great restaurants/bars in walking distance. 

Host is attentive, informative, and made sure that I have everything I need for my stay. Fast response. Easy to communicate. Keys pick up/drop off are easy. Accommodating. 

Place is on a smaller side (well, it's NYC) but perfect for me as I was by myself. It has everythings I needed and nothing I didn't need. Comfy bed. Modern kitchen space to prepare coffee/food. Super clean. Lots of light during the day. Washer/dryer, which is kind of luxury in NYC. Bathtub to relax. Building is clean and quiet.

Gina was the most welcoming host and provided everything I needed and if not she was quick to organize.  Great at communication - I knew exactly all the detials for my stay very quickly and efficently. Plus, she gave local tips and hot spots to try - fab! I would highly recommned this apartment. It is small, but well equipt, fantastic location and in the heart of Chelsea! After living in NYC for three month here I cam to love the washing maching in the unit (luxury). I loved my extended stay and enjoyed living there.

This is my the most favorite place to stay in Manhattan. This is a high-end area of Chelsea with beautiful trees, beautiful people and beautiful cafes. It's been my second time booking this flat, and I have no regrets. 

The host is fantastic. She is so accommodating, so polite and so friendly. She is always available over the phone / text/ email to answer all the questions and to give any recommendation on secret spots in NYC. She always makes me feel like I'm coming to visit my good friend's place who is out of town. 

Her place is well kept, spotless clean, modern and has an exposed brick wall for added character. The key pickup&dropoff is super smooth and available 24/7. 

This is great for a nomad like myself or a business traveler or even someone who wants to explore NY as a real New Yorker and avoid all the touristy spots yet be conveniently close to them. This is no large place but totally perfect for one person. 

There are the best bagel place, lots of bakeries and coffee shops in the neighborhood. Also it's conveniently close to subway. And forgot to mention, it's just one block from High Line!!! One of the evening I stayed, I saw a famous producer at the restaurant close by - I know it's not about the listing but the neighborhood is so cool. 

Love it! Recommend it! Looking forward to be back!

the location is perfect. I felt calm and safe
deli, 24hours cvs ..etc, everything is near the place.
it was my first AIRBNB, Gina makes me use this later again :) she is really kind and sweet. always ask me if there are problem with place! also whenever I'd like to contact her to ask something, she replied directly :)
you will not regret if choose this lovely place!

This is a very comfortable, clean and convenient place to stay in. Gina is one of the best, very rare and responsible hosts that you may not know still exists, She was always concerned about my stay in her well stocked apartment. Living there is made even easier by the availability of a washer/drier within the room, its proximity to the 1,2, E and C subway stations and affordable supermarkets and restaurants. I will always recommend this place to anyone wishing to stay in a clean, comfortable, quiet and convenient place.
Gina is an amazing host and is always available. The apartment is super cozy, clean, comfortable, and close to all amenities. I highly recommend it!!!
Gina is terrific. Rented it for my 21 year old daughter doing an internship in NYC

Very quaint flat in a great and very calm neighborhood. It is indeed very small but perfect for one person as the space is very optimized! It even includes an iron and a washing machine. Overall it feels very cosy and works perfectly as a pied-à-terre after long days exploring New York. Subways are very close, another plus. I usually like airbnbs notably for the opportunity to meet with the renter/ sub-renter which was not the case here, but Gina had set up a convenient pick-up location for me to get the keys by myself upon arrival. At a broader level, my stay in New York was fantastic and I felt well in this flat
Cute little apartment in Chelsea. Exactly as it looks in photo - new interiors, super cosy and in a great area. Gina was super helpful - thanks for the stay!

What a great little place to have discovered to stay at in NYC.  Perfect for one person. Small but not crammed. Well equipped and nicely  decorated. I felt immediately at home on arrival. 
I found the location brilliant , all I needed and more was within walking distance.  Great places to eat  minutes away , and with subway stations so near I got to Lincoln centre in record time. 

Also Gina left me with great info for anyplace of interest etc. , which is always useful. 

She  was in fact an all round perfect host. 

Will certainly book again.
Great studio apartment in a great location.   Modern and up to date.  Very Clean.
Gina is an outstanding host with a terrific, cozy place. Excellent location to get out and see the city.

Gina's place is just as described and as seen in the pictures. The location is fantastic and the place has everything you might need. Close to the subway and a nice walk into the city. I wouldn't hesitate in staying there again or recommending the place to anyone !!

Gina's place was very accurate to the images and was close to alot of great restaurants and the metro.  I only had a few problems during my stay, however Gina was quick to address the issues, overall was a great trip.

cosy but perfect for single person stay. love the area ! lots of art gallery around. there is 24H open restaurants, Rite Aid pharmacy just around the corner. Gina(host) is also wonderful well communication person.
Check-in was easy and the place was simple and clean. I would happily stay here again.
Very nice apartment and great neighborhood
Gina was helpful, flexible, and quick to respond. The location was close to everything and I really enjoyed the cozy atmosphere!

I loved my stay at Gina's. She is a wonder host, extremely prompt in her communication, checking in to see that things are okay. The City had a big winter while I visited and Gina made sure that the cold was controlled in the apartment. She also sent me a detailed message with all kinds of recommendations for the area, including a real New York bagel shop I was keen on checking out. I love walking Manhattan, so I walked up and down from Gina's apartment, but the metro connection is excellent also. The apartment is a compact, cute little treasure, and I really enjoyed it. Thank you, Gina, for the attentive, warm hospitality!

First, Gina was an amazing communicator. She was very easy to talk to, and quick with her responses. Her apartment was cozy and comfortable. I also appreciated that there were sufficient toiletries (as well as extra's in the closet!) Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here, and I would absolutely stay here again.
Gina's place was great! - clean, efficient, quiet.  Location in Chelsea was just what we wanted.  Short walk to Chelsea Market.  Gina was excellent, good communication.  Would stay again.
It was a very pleasant stay at Gina’s place. Chelsea is such a great area and living in Chelsea kinda gives me a “sex and the city” vibe. Love it!!

OTTIMO NIDO PER CHI DEVE VENIRE A LAVORARE A NYC PER BREVI PERIODI. PULIZIA E CURA DEI DETTAGLI SONO I PUNTI DI FORZA DI GINA OLTRE AD ESSERE UN HOST PREMUROSO E ATTENTO ALLE NECESSITA' DEL SUO GUEST. BRAVA GINA! OTTIMO RAPPORTO VALUE FOR MONEY E GRANDE FACILITA' NEI RAPPORTI.

The apartment is as shown, but best for one on a business trip than two who wish to hang around during the day. It is certainly compact but very clean and great location. It is on the ground level, so noise can be a bit of an issue if you are a sensitive sleeper.

Gina’s place was wonderful, cute and cozy and in a great location. Exactly as described and very quick and easy check in. Great communication at any time and always willing to help. The onily weird thing was that the listing had a 1pm check out (and in my trips section still says 1, I made sure to triple check) but was told it was 12 the night before so that threw me off a little but otherwise everything was great.

The apartment is located on a pretty tree-lined street, walking distance from multiple lines on the subway on the west side. 
The layout is really nice and homely and despite being street level it’s really quiet at night. 
Gina was so fast with responses, I would stay there next time I’m in NYC for sure

Hostess is excellent. She has thought of everything. Communication was A plus. She made arrival and leaving very easy. Her recommendations as to nearby cafes and restaurants were very helpful. Coffee and diners within one block. The apartment is located in a lively neighborhood   Very easy to catch cabs or Uber’s or Lyft. The apartment is small but yet has a full size tub. The apartment was super clean and it was stocked with coffee and tea which I appreciated. I walk with a cane. It being at street level was important to me. Excellent cable and internet. Highly recommend.
Perfect location, perfect size for one or two people looking to take a trip to the city.
Great location, great communication. Studio is small but has everything you need and the location is great. Perfect for 1 person or a couple. Great neighborhood.
Gina's place is in a nice neighborhood and on the first floor (no lugging bags upstairs!). Very quiet and comfortable. Within walking distance to lots of shops and the subway.

This little space was a perfect jumping-off point for the meetings and errands I had in the city. Coming back to Chelsea at night really felt like coming home - lots of amenities, friendly street life, comfortable bed . . . Picking up and dropping off keys was convenient and well-explained. Communication was lighting fast, including responses to specific questions about NYC advice. HIGHLY recommend. Thank you, G!

Gina’s place is in the most fantastic location in Chelsea. It was perfect for a solo traveller and was well-appointed with washing machine / dryer and steamer, kitchenette with fridge, toaster, kettle, coffee maker and mini gas stove. Gina was great to communicate with and sent me an awesome list of recommendations in the area. It’s super close to the High line and I walked along the high line daily to my conference at the Javits centre. Unfortunately the radiator was too hot and hard to turn down / off. It’s right next to the bed so sometimes I had to compensate by turning on the aircon to sleep at night. The key pick up and drop off is a few blocks away.

I stayed 5 nights in Gina's modern, comfortable studio.  As a female traveling alone, it was important to me to feel safe walking around the neighborhood alone, and I definitely did, even at night. The studio is compact but has everything you need, it was clean and the perfect place for a single traveler. The location is amazing- High Line Park is 2 blocks away, as is 24 hr drugstores and many restaurants. 5 short blocks to Chelsea Market. Metro stop was few blocks away, loads of bus stops, and easy pick up spot for Uber pick up.  If you're into walking, it's walking distance to so many different areas it all took me 15-30 min. It's an absolutely wonderful area to stay especially if you have already been to NYC a few times and want to go/do things more that the locals do!

I only had 1 issue during my stay, and Gina tried her best to resolve it. Unfortunately it couldn't be resolved till the end of my stay,  but Gina was kind and considerate, and had quick communication. She also has great tips for places to eat or go to if you need that. I would love to stay here again and would highly recommend!

All those reviews got it just right! Great location, and the place is just as described/pictured. Sparkling clean. Loved the bed, loved the shower, loved the neighborhood!  Gina responds quickly. Check in and out was easy and straightforward.

Gina was an excellent host.  The apartment was exactly as pictured: petite but highly functional, clean, modern and a very pleasant place to stay in a beautiful neighborhood.  When there was a slight hiccup involving Gina's Super insisting on doing work on her apartment (albeit at a convenient time during the late morning), Gina responded with appropriate dismay (she was not made aware of the work) and even went as far as refunding me a portion of my rental payment as a courtesy for my troubles.  Excellent communication and responses.  Very cozy apartment.  Highly recommend, especially just for one!
Excellent space in great location
Perfect for one person. Everything you need in the flat. Gina was an excellent communicator. Great location!

Gina's place is really stylish and cute. It's in a frankly perfect location in Manhattan (an easy walk into Midtown, and really close to the High line and Chelsea market). Gina is very thoughtful and communicates extremely quickly - it was a real pleasure to stay in her lovely apartment. Thank you so much for being such a considerate host!

Gina’s spot could not be more perfect and quaint. Would most definitely stay here again. She delievered quick communication and wonderful nearby recommendations. The location of the space is perfect for walking around the city, easy access to subways, and so close to tons of great eateries! The apartment itself was so clean and cute too. Would definitely recommend staying here!!!
Exactly as described....fantastic location and perfect for person travelling alone....or a couple
Cozy and well appointed in a great area with easy access to public transportation.  Best for one person.
Very pleasant stay. No surprises, on the contrary, Gina is a host that takes care of all details. Clean, nice apt. Close by to nice restaurants.
Stylish studio apartment in a fantastic midtown location.
Unbeatable location. Great host and amazing value.  I would stay at Gina’s again.
Very nice 1 bedroom in a quiet area but very close to high line and Chelsea
Gina was a pleasure to deal with! The space is very comfy and has everything you need. Location is unbeatable. I recommend it 100%

Best place to stay! Small but everything is there, plates, glasses etc. Nice bed and shower.
Communication before and during stay was Good. She responds very fast.
Great location, lovely home, great facilities. Very clean and tidy.

This was one of the best Airbnb Experiences I ever had. The apartment was exactly as described. Perfect for my needs. One the first floor, clean, adorable. It's small - but that's New York. It's perfect for a solo traveler - especially on there on business. I had everything I needed - a full kitchen, there was coffee and tea and other (more than) basic necessities already in the kitchen, a small fridge, coffee maker, toaster oven, even a microwave and a stovetop - and the most exciting part of all - a washing machine! Which in New York is as rare as a unicorn. I used the machine a few times, it's a washer and dryer and it was so helpful to be able to do laundry while I was in the city without having to send it out. Everything in the apartment is clean, and well designed. The bed was super comfortable. There is air conditioning and heat. The apartment is also very well stocked with everything you could possibly need. The area as adorable - lots of really great high quality restaurants and shops, a grocery store one block away, places to get your nails done - coffee shops, cafes, everything you need in New York. It is about a 5 minute walk away from the subway. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

The apartment is super cute, clean, and cozy. It has all the basic amenities with extra personal touches. Upon arrival, you quickly get a true feeling of what it’s like to live on one of the quaintest blocks of Chelsea.

This is the second time I have stayed at Gina's apartment and I love it. It has everything you could possibly need while you are away and the location is amazing. Right near two subway lines and a nice walk to mid Town. Highly recommended.

Really cute space that was sparkling clean and had loads of extras like towels and blankets. Even had a clothing steamer which I really appreciated and I actually found this to be the quietest place I’ve ever stayed at in NYC. Note: if you are not able-bodied or have a lot of heavy luggage, the keys are a couple blocks away. But the second set of keys and auto-lock doors made check out much easier than check in! Overall, very comfortable stay and Gina was always prompt to respond. Would stay again!
Great location in Chelsea! Cozy space with everything you need.
Great place and a nice host
Si pudiera darle 10000 puntos lo haría
The place was lovely! Thanks Gina!

My stay at Gina's was even better then I expected, next time I will go to NYC I will try to get to Gina's place again. Excellent location, calm street, clean and cosy apartment,  Gina's great comunication, close to subway and food and everything you need.
Lovely space in an amazing location, felt like we were home in the city, highly recommended.

I stayed at Gina’s for two weeks. 
Gina was quick to respond, super helpful with answering all my questions, shared an amazing list of things to do/places to go. 
The apt is a small studio and I was surprised to discover it had literally everything you would need and then some. Tons of sheets and towels! 
It is located in a very convenient spot in Chelsea - close to the subway, numerous restaurants (all of Gina’s suggestions were delish!), several convenience stores and so on. It is within walking distance to the shops and restaurants in the Meatpacking District, which lets you avoid having to go to the same places in super crowded Midtown. 
I had a great stay and would totally recommend staying at Gina’s! :)
It’s a very nice, clean and perfectly located studio. Gina was helpful throughout the whole check in process. You can’t go wrong if you pick this place.

Gina's place was perfect! In a great location, it was cosy and very designed with fast Wifi for any business travelers. I had a bit of personal trouble with the door (turn gently to the right!) but it was an impeccable time otherwise. I'd highly recommend it to all NY travelers!
great location. very accommodating and responsive host. clean apartment. just what you need when staying in NY
True to phots;  cozy and inviting

Our stay in New York was a lot of fun. Gina's place in Chelsea was a cute, stylish little studio. The photos gave us a clear expectation of the space. There were dishes present for eating in, if we wanted. We enjoyed the coffee that was present for us in the mornings. Gina was quick to respond when I had questions before my visit. The hot water was immediate with the shower, and there were multiple shower toiletries available if needed. There was also a washer available with detergent and stain remover (which I did need at one point and was grateful for). The property is on the first floor, so the property has very easy access when bringing in luggage. There are several restaurants within a five minute walk (including a delicious bagel place around the corner where we had breakfast every day). The neighbors were also very quiet, we never heard anyone besides ourselves. And overall the property was very clean when were arrived. We never actually met or talked with Gina since she has efficiently set up check in to not require meeting anyone.

There were a few things that were not ideal. Sleeping was not very comfortable. You could feel the bars of the metal platform bed through the mattress, and the mattress was sinking in between the bars. The window also provides very little protection from the elements. We visited in February, and the city was very cold at night. There is a sheet of plastic and a towel taped against the window to try and block off the elements, but there was still a consistent breeze from outside that was most noticeable at night if you were unlucky enough to be the person sleeping on the window side of the bed. There were several heaters in the place, and that helped, but it caused one half of you to be hot while the other half facing the window was cold. We actually opted to head home one night early because we were eager to sleep in our own bed.

name: 2BR Sunlight & Secret Garden Apartment
summary: Minimal meets vintage, with loads of light and plants in this 2 bedroom apartment. The space is all custom and hand built by the owner, a fashion designer. The apartment has a secret garden guests are welcome to use. Vintage details are paired with modern appliances and great heating and air conditioning throughout the house. Located in historic central Brooklyn, you'll be steps away from great restaurants, cafes, nightlife, and transport.
space: Hello -  I have a south facing, sun-drenched 2-bedroom apartment in Crown Heights, Brooklyn.  The bedrooms are private and cozy. Each are open plan with wall-mounted racks for your clothing. They both have very comfy queen-sized beds with high thread count sheets. They also boast a lot of space under the bed for luggage or anything else. The house has central heating and AC separate controls for each room, so you'll never be too hot or too cold. As you can see in the pictures, the main room is a kitchen/living space which is shared. There is also a balcony outside the main space which has a stair access down to the garden. The garden is very large with lots of outdoor seating. The garden is shared during the week days with the coworking space I run on the first floor. The apartment comes with free WiFi during your stay, and I provide a set of towels as well. (No one likes to travel with towels). The kitchen could be called a chef's kitchen, because it's pretty big. The oven is convecti
description: Minimal meets vintage, with loads of light and plants in this 2 bedroom apartment. The space is all custom and hand built by the owner, a fashion designer. The apartment has a secret garden guests are welcome to use. Vintage details are paired with modern appliances and great heating and air conditioning throughout the house. Located in historic central Brooklyn, you'll be steps away from great restaurants, cafes, nightlife, and transport. Hello -  I have a south facing, sun-drenched 2-bedroom apartment in Crown Heights, Brooklyn.  The bedrooms are private and cozy. Each are open plan with wall-mounted racks for your clothing. They both have very comfy queen-sized beds with high thread count sheets. They also boast a lot of space under the bed for luggage or anything else. The house has central heating and AC separate controls for each room, so you'll never be too hot or too cold. As you can see in the pictures, the main room is a kitchen/living space which is shared. There is also a b
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is awesome with the house located just off Franklin Ave which has lots of great restaurants, bars, and shops. We have a wonderful supermarket 2 blocks away.
notes: The house has a projector which can be connected to your computer and allows for films or internet TV to be watched on a 12 foot projected screen with surround sound. It also has Apple TV if you get tired of exploring and want a night in with Netflix.
transit: The Subways A,C,4,5,2,3 are all within 5 minutes. I Get to midtown in 25 minutes easy. The A train which come from JFK airport is 4 blocks away at Nostrand Ave. Airport to my place in about 40 minutes.
access: Guests are welcome to the kitchen, living room, bathroom, balcony, and garden.
interaction: If possible I'll be there for "check-in" and "check-out". If not I use a lock box.
house_rules: Please leave my house as you found it. Thank you.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about:
Hi there,

I run a fashion design company working concept to completion in all aspect of the industry. I also run a co-working space where 70+ other freelancers share ideas and good vibes. I love all thing art and design. I'm very easy going and respectful. I'm interested in traveling broadly and living locally. When I travel, I prefer to live as much like a local and stay away from the "main attractions".

I love vintage and antiques.
I love motorcycles.
I love breakfast.
I love to read and understand current affairs.
I love a good chat and to learn about other peoples professions, especially if they're passionate about them.

I look forward to hosting and or staying with you.

reviews.comments: Sam's place was great. We loved the neighbourhood. Some great bars are just up the street and the subway is a short walk away. We never met Sam but he was easy to communicate with. Amazingly decorated and spacious apartment that felt like home. My only wish would have been that the place was a little cleaner but otherwise no other complaints.

A beautiful apartment with incredible attention to detail and excellent style! We loved staying at Sam's apartment. The location is great with tons of cool bars nearby, the Brooklyn Museum, Prospect Pk, and all the subway lines you could ever need. The kitchen is spacious with a great induction stove, and the main room is great for small gatherings with drinks. Lots of sunlight throughout. Very comfortable beds and the balcony overlooking the garden was really lovely. Everything from the spices, kitchen ware, towels and basic food items were well-stocked! Good central speakers in the kitchen for playing music. Sam was very communicative, accommodating and a very solid host! We'd love to stay there again.

Our stay in Sam's place was really nice! We never met Sam but he was always available to answer our questions during booking. A friend of his welcome us when we got there. She was very helpful with us, give us some cool places to go around. Electric problems did not allow us to use some heaters, so the temperature was a little cold, mostly for the person who slept in the lounge. We felt secure in the streets and you have to walk like 5 minutes to take the train that lead you on manhattan. Good place to stay! Thanks!

Sam's space is really stylish. He's clearly put a lot of work into making it a unique and classy home. We were travelling with our one-year-old toddler which presented some challenges, and I would not recommend this apartment to someone else travelling with a small child who might throw food on the rug, eat off the painted plywood floors, and pull things off shelves. We were able to make it work, and Sam was very helpful answering our questions. If you're young at heart, hip and excited to explore gritty Brooklyn, this place is ideal.

Sam was a great host and my family loved living in his beautiful apartment. The apartment has great light, a comfortable living space and a very tasteful decor, right from the coffee table to the chandelier in the bathroom. The kitchen is spacious for those who want to cook their meals. The area is great and has some wonderful restaurants and bars and really charming to walk around in. Unfortunately, we left a little bit of mess when we checked out, which probably means that we won't get to stay in this wonderful apartment again, but for those of you who can, you absolutely must.

Pour un voyage d'affaire, un de mes équipiers a séjourné chez Sam. Très agréable, quartier sympathique. Un appartement clair et un hôte prévenant !
Thomas était vraiment content de son séjour !

The neighborhood is an interesting one, with many places to get grocery or to eat at, and Sam was of good advice. The flat is nice, we had breakfast on the balcony every morning. It is very easy to go to downtown with either the C or 5 line, or to Conney Island the other direction.
We really enjoyed our stay at Sam's bright stylish apartment and enjoyed the colorful neighborhood.  Sam was also very helpful and responsive with communication.

Sam was a great host and his apartment was so comfy and enjoyable (very nice garden)! He left addresses of great places to go, plans of the neighborhood, etc. The neighborhood is amazing, lots of nice bars, very good restaurants and most important, nearby lots of trains station. We definitely enjoyed our stay thanks to Sam's apartment! Merci beaucoup Sam!!

The apartment is exactly as described…. Super super sunny! Maybe a little shade is the bedrooms will help in the morning!

Sam was very easy to communicate with and we never ran in any problem.
The reservation was canceled 37 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 27 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Sam's apartment was a great place to return to every evening after adventuring across New York with kids. It's pretty much exactly the same as it's described in the listing, and the kitchen has a great induction stove. The aircon was invaluable as we stay during some of the hottest and most humid days in recent history. We felt secure and private at Sam's and would highly recommend it for singles, couples or small families.
Franklin Ave is the main shopping strip plenty of good grocery shopping, a decent coffee spot 7 mins walk away, a cool pizza restaurant, laundromats, and wine shops.
The subway is close enough walking distance. (I found Uber a fairly easy alternative for one-off transports in and out of Manhattan.) Both subway stations within walking distance take you to Brookyn and through Manhattan easy enough. 
All up a great stay.
Sam's place is perfectly designed. Sunny, stylish, open, this was a fantastic apartment to relax in amidst the chaos of our weekend in NY.
Exactly as described. Very clean and comfortable. Extremely covenient. Excellent communication. Great kitchen. Would definetly book w Sam again.

Great location, a few blocks away from the subway. (About a 10 minute walk.) lots of restaurants in the area, delis on the corners. If you’re sleeping 4 two people can sleep on the couches and two in each bedrooms (or whatever). There is no pull out. I’d recommend shower shoes as the rug in bathroom is small and thin. There’s a cool projector , and Bose speaker for music. Overall the place was nice and aesthetically pleasing, and Sam was quick to respond when we had questions.
It’s a really nice place.

name: Wan Chai Fully Furnished Studio
summary: Fully Furnished Studio located in the the center of Wan Chai area. 5 minutes walking distance to both Wan Chai and Causeway Bay MTR station. Easy access to Hong Kong Exhibition Center, Times Square, and Sogo. Perfect for bachelor with Bars/Restaurants nearby the Lockhart/Jerreries Road. Building with elevator and 24/7 security guard. Small buy cosy studio with TV, private bathroom, kitchen air-conditioning and a working desk. Free Wifi access. 7-11 and laundry shop right next to the entrance.
space: Around 120 square feet. Private bathroom with shower  15 inches wall mounted flat screen TV Single bed with blanket, pillow and beddings Small kitchen with electronic cooker, kettle and other utensils  Working desk with chair Small fridge  Air conditioning Free WiFi access
description: Fully Furnished Studio located in the the center of Wan Chai area. 5 minutes walking distance to both Wan Chai and Causeway Bay MTR station. Easy access to Hong Kong Exhibition Center, Times Square, and Sogo. Perfect for bachelor with Bars/Restaurants nearby the Lockhart/Jerreries Road. Building with elevator and 24/7 security guard. Small buy cosy studio with TV, private bathroom, kitchen air-conditioning and a working desk. Free Wifi access. 7-11 and laundry shop right next to the entrance. Around 120 square feet. Private bathroom with shower  15 inches wall mounted flat screen TV Single bed with blanket, pillow and beddings Small kitchen with electronic cooker, kettle and other utensils  Working desk with chair Small fridge  Air conditioning Free WiFi access Elevator access with 24/7 security guard in the building Laundry shop right next to the entrance of the building 2 minute walk to tram station 5 minute walk to Wan Chai MTR station  5 minute walk to Causeway Bay MTR station  5 m
neighborhood_overview: 2 minute walk to tram station 5 minute walk to Wan Chai MTR station  5 minute walk to Causeway Bay MTR station  5 minute walk to Times Square 5 minute walk to Wan Chai Computer Center 5 minute walk to bars/restaurants in Lockhart/Jefferies Road area 7 minute walk to Wan Chai Convention Center Easy access to to LKF, the peak and Soho by MTR from Wan Chai Station to Central
transit: Many public transports are available including bus, minibus, tram and MTR. There is a tram station nearby with around 2 minutes walk and both the Wan Chai and Causeway Bay MTR station are within walking distance which can link you to most of Hong Kong
access: Elevator access with 24/7 security guard in the building Laundry shop right next to the entrance of the building
interaction: Available prior to and during the stay in order to answer questions. Happy to make suggestions and plan your trip in Hong Kong.
house_rules: 1) Please keep the place as original as possible and clear all the garbage before checking out.  2) Please turn on the water heater around 10 minutes before using and turn it off after finished shower. One of the previous guests has broken the heater so a new one is installed and would prefer the guest to use is more carefully.  3) Please turn on the air con when you need it and turn it off when going out. There has been a few guests leaving the air condition on when check out and wasted a lot of electricity.

address.street: Hong Kong, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong

reviews.comments: Stephen's place is neat, clean and as described.  Size is perfect for single traveller.  Stephen is very responsive.  Location is good with lots of restaurants around. Walking distance to MTR station is about 5 mins, very convenient. I enjoyed my stay very much at Stephen's place.

Small, one person room (size makes it a single room) not really well sound isolated against the neigbours. Recently renovated so fresh bathroom, could be better with something that blocks out the light from the "window" if you are a person that have trouble sleeping if it's to light in the room.

My stay in Hong Kong and at Stephen's flat went very smoothly and without any inconveniences. The flat is in a central location and easy to find as Stephen provided very good directions to the place with pictures and everything.

The room was as depicted in the pics and is suitable for 1 person to stay.

The room is tinier than I thought without any windows out. Another problem was that no cleaning supplies - not even a brush - was provided in the room. If you stay several days in the flat, as I did, it would be comfortable to clean and tidy up a bit every day.
Great location and beautiful room! Had a great time there. Host is awesome!
Good budget room for HK, clean and convenient, but no outside window :) Late check-in was easy and smooth. It's a good deal, at this price it's hard to find better in Wan Chai.
This is my second stay at Stephen's.  It's as good as my last stay.

The place was hard to find for me as the entrance is small and easy to miss. Nice cosy room that's in a central location. Desk and good wifi allowed me to work in the room. Fridge is useful for keeping food and drinks! And I like how there's food places just downstairs and everywhere around the building.

Great location in a reasonably modern building with a lift (which is a huge bonus having stayed on the 8th floor of a building without a lift last time I came to HK). Host was helpful and friendly and the room was clean with decent strength wifi, cold aircon and hot water.

Please note that facilities / amenities are minimal. There is a fridge, a kettle, and some bodywash/shampoo. You will need to supply your own towels plus cutlery and cups / glasses if you wish to eat or drink in the apartment (there are no cooking or laundry facilities either).

All in all, a good budget - if basic - place to stay in central Hong Kong.
It is a confortable room very well located!
Excellent location and great host! Remember to bring your own towle to this place.
The location is good.  Neighbourhood full of eateries.  Room is bigger than some other airbnb place.  Bathroom is clean.  Lift is located at the ground floor.  Good value for money.

Stephen was easy to reach via (Hidden by Airbnb) and the checkin instructions were very clear and easy to follow. The neighborhood and building feels very authentic and it is easy to walk to everything like restaurants/MTR/buses.

The room itself is very small and has no windows, so this is not a good place if you want to spend much time in your room. However, as a place to sleep and shower (plenty of hot water and good pressure) it was just fine. And at this price, you cannot expect more in HK.

The apartment looks exactly like the photos. Clean and nice. All the amenities are working perfectly good (the wifi, fridge, water heater, aircon, kettle) Good and central location with many shops and eateries around, near the MTR station. Stephen is very friendly and responses promptly. Ideal place to stay for solo traveller, value for money too.

Pros: Stephen was super responsive. I appreciate immensely that he contacted me several days before my arrival to arrange for key handover. The building is located in a very convenient spot -- eateries, transportation (7-min walk to closest MTR station, a few minutes away on foot from bus 5/5X that goes to Stanley Market or the 100-series buses on Wanchai Rd. that go to the Kowloon side using the tunnel and you'll arrive at Hunghom where you can take the MTR and trains to NWT and China; tramway, and lots of taxis). Despite the various problems re: cleanliness, Stephen was quick to arrange for his maid to show up more than once. And as other guests noted, hard to find a place so conveniently located at this price.

Cons: I would remove the "newly" word from the property's title of "newly decorated apartment". The cleaner obviously did a superficial job only--found dust and tissue bits below the bed and mouldy caulking around the bathroom sink. A working fridge was one of my must-have items, but was disappointed to find the fridge seal was extremely mouldy, including certain parts inside. I guess my biggest surprise is that this room is actually a room within an apartment which is subdivided into five rooms. There is no window as understood through other reviews and confirmation from Stephen, so won't be suitable for those who are claustrophobic, and you'll have to rely entirely on the air conditioning for fresh air. There is, however, a pseudo-window slot that is open to the corridor in the common area. Would have made the space much more homey if there were a small curtain covering this pseudo-window space since it is half-covered by a file folder and you can still see the dirty metal guard and the sheet of dirty plastic with a hole for the air cond. unit exhaust. I was much taken aback by this after seeing the more "modern" amenities, such as the cupboards and bathroom tiles. Another thing that bothered me was the absence of hooks for clothing, except for the three tiny adhesive hooks in the bathroom (but since the shower is in the same space as the toilet, one cannot use these tiny hooks for dry clothing anyways) and the bar on the glass door (but I didn't want to hang too much on it since the bar is against a glass door). Hence, the only chair in the space is hijacked by my clothes. So if you plan to stay there more than a week, you might find it inconvenient. 

All in all, if you don't have a keen eye for cleanliness, you will like this place for its proximity to amenities and quick response from host.

Hint: If you arrive at the building by taxi, give the taxi driver the Wood Road address, but then you'll have to walk to the Heard Street entrance to enter the building since the security code doesn't work on the Wood Road entrance.
Thanks Stephen for the stay, its been great.
The location was good and there is convenient store located right below the apartment! Host was fast at reply, enjoyed my stay! Apartment was true to picture.

I've been did HK several times, this was my first time exploring the HK side instead of Kowloon. I'm glad I chose this place, it's walking distance to a lot of places, there's a bus or tram nearby to take you wherever. The neighbor's can get a little noisy, but they make sure to stop before bedtime, so if noise is a problem, just go out to a cafe or put on some headphones. I'd recommend this place.
very good location near bus stops. clean room. good sized room with enough space for a luggage.
Very nice room for a affordable price in Hong Kong!
cozy and enough hospitality.

If you’re after somewhere convenient, and a place to simply rest up, then Stephen’s little all-in-one room-esque apartment is the place to stay!

Take note that the room is considered very small for non-HK standards, but it’s more than enough if you’re simply after a space to rest up for the night, and even kick back a little or just getting some work done (there’s a decently-sized desk). But most importantly, it’s clean!

Extremely close to most major bus routes serving the Wan Chai area, including those to/from the airport (A11 or E11/E11A); ~10 mins walk to Wan Chai MTR (Causeway Bay is just a bit more); tram line is just a block away; several convenience stores just a stone throw’s away; and local HK delicacies right downstairs (must-try if you’ve never had them before!)

Will definitely be back again — thanks again for a great stay, Stephen! :)
The location is great, easy access to public transport and food. Stephen has been very responsive and helpful throughout our stay. The price is relatively low in CBD area, good for budget trip!
Good location. Perfect for a single traveler.
Very clean and easy to communicate with. Good value!
Fantastic place. My only complaint is the bed. It isn’t very sturdy.
Stephen's place is very comfortable and has everything you'll need for a good stay in HK. The room is very clean, feels and looks new. I would definatelly stay again there.

Very quick response.
Good location and clean room. Highly recommended especially for solo travelers.
ok
Stephen's place is a tiny apartment in a great location in the city. For the price you get a great base with all the basics. Definitely recommend for a budget traveler.
Good location, perfect for solo
Appartement as expected, Stephen is very helpful and cares about his guests. 100% recommended.!

Convenient location, many restaurants and shops; easy access to places you want to go. Quick response to my questions. Bathroom supplies and kitchen cooking wares & utensils were provided as well.  Had a very pleasant stay. Highly recommended!

name: Large Studio with Harbour glimpses, City Fringe
summary: Fully Furnished, spacious studio apartment, on the 14th floor with partial distant views to Sydney Harbour.  The apartment hotel is located on the Darlinghurst side of Hyde Park, just a few minutes walk across Hyde Park and you will be in the heart of the Sydney CBD.
space: Spacious studio apartment, on the 14th floor of Hyde Park Plaza, with partial distant views to Sydney Harbour. The apartment hotel is located on the Darlinghurst side of Hyde Park, just a few minutes walk across Hyde Park and you will be in the heart of the CBD. There is a small balcony, with an outdoor setting, providing glimpses of the harbour water views. The studio faces the back of the building and away from the traffic noise of Oxford Street. Full kitchen facilities, air-conditioning, TV. There is a double pull-down sofa for extra guests.The apartment has a walk-in wardrobe through to the modern bathroom with bathtub, with shower over the bath.  Within a security, complex, with 24-hour reception, and facilities include a common laundry, rooftop with views & outdoor heated pool & gym.
description: Fully Furnished, spacious studio apartment, on the 14th floor with partial distant views to Sydney Harbour.  The apartment hotel is located on the Darlinghurst side of Hyde Park, just a few minutes walk across Hyde Park and you will be in the heart of the Sydney CBD. The apartment hotel is located on the Darlinghurst side of Hyde Park, just a few minutes walk across Hyde Park and you will be in the heart of the CBD. There is a small balcony, with an outdoor setting, providing glimpses of the harbour water views. The studio faces the back of the building and away from the traffic noise of Oxford Street. Full kitchen facilities, air-conditioning, TV. There is a double pull-down sofa for extra guests.The apartment has a walk-in wardrobe through to the modern bathroom with bathtub, with shower over the bath.  Within a security, complex, with 24-hour reception, and facilities inclu
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in Darlinghurst, right on the fringe of the Sydney CBD, it is a busy area, you should feel safe to walk around day or night and experience everything the area and beyond has to offer. Let me (Andrea your host) know what type of cuisine you like, so I can give you some recommendations for local restaurants/cafes.
transit: There are many great dining options within walking distance of your accommodation. Buses, taxi's/Uber are available within footsteps of your door.  The location is a safe 2-5 walk minute across Hyde Park into Sydney CBD, Museum Train Station is within a 2-5 minute walk, the airport is around 15-20 minutes drive away Let me (Andrea your host) know what Sydney attractions are of interest to you, so I can give you some recommendations on transport to and from these.
access: Facilities available for all guests: common laundry.  Outdoor rooftop pool area with views & gym.  This is a secure building with restricted lift access and common areas. OPTIONAL EXTRAS - you may wish to request for your stay: - Wireless Broadband Modem - Second set of linen/towels - Portable Baby Cot  Feel free to contact me (your host) in advance of your stay to arrange any extras/comforts you may require, I will let you know then of any extra cost that will be incurred.
interaction: Upon confirmation of your reservation, you will receive detailed information with the arrangement for key collections, and contact phone numbers in the event that you need any assistance during your stay. There are three key collection options for you to choose from: 1) On-site at the reception for the complex, that this apartment is located within 2.Your keys can be held for you at a Kingsford office (en-route between the airport and Sydney city) 3. A representative for the studio can meet you at the property address to pass keys, and familiarise you with your accommodation (option 3 = fee applicable)
house_rules: Please be aware of the following Terms and Conditions and that as a guest you have acknowledged by clicking on 'request to book' via Airbnb that you are confirming that you understand the following Terms and Conditions and your guest responsibilities under the 'house rules'!  Arrival/Departure: Check-in time is from 2 pm; check-out time is by 10:00 am. If you require a late check-out, please advise at least 24 hours in advance and your host will do the best to satisfy your request, although this cannot be guaranteed. Keys can be collected from a Kingsford office (en-route between the airport and Sydney city), or your host can arrange to have you met at the property on arrival, however, this service may not be available at certain times and a charge will apply for this service. Guests are required to phone representative 1 hour before arrival, without exception. This is to ensure that there is someone available to serve you. Your host takes no responsibility for waiting times when check

host.host_about:
Hello and thanks for taking the time to read my profile. I am a roaming New Zealander now settled in Australia's most picturesque city of Sydney. I am delighted to become an Airbnb host of apartment/condominium/self-contained/flat style of accommodation right here in Sydney. 

45 years old, I have been a travel agent since my early twenties, this job experience coupled with my own extensive travel around the world (including many successful stays booked via Airbnb) plus meeting my travel client expectations has armed me with extensive knowledge base of what guests require of their stay.

Please do not hesitate to contact me with any questions you may have in regards to the property you will be staying in, transport, activities, events, Sydney itself, I will be very happy to help with any information I can.

reviews.comments:
The location of this property was central to transport - an easy train ride in from the airport and short walk from museum station

Lots of communication from the host.

The property was nothing special - served its purpose - wouldn't rush back in a hurry - hosts could do a lot more to make the property more accommodating for business guests

Nice apartment located in Darlinghurst. Central to many touristic places. Close to little Italy. 
Many cafes and restaurants around. 
The place was clean and good for a family of four. Second bed is a convertible that is ok for young kids if to be shared. 
Easy to check in and check out. Andrea is very helpful and available. Communication by email only.
It was god and a perfect location

This place was a great location if you want a simple place to sleep. The place overall was a bit run-down compared to the photos, but was the perfect location if you are interested in walking to the water such as Darling Harbour. Andrea was a very responsive host. Our only complaints were some bathroom bugs and hearing the elevator operating throughout the night since we were right next door.

name: Doorman, modern apart. on Broadway (Central Park)
summary: The apartment is right in the hustle-bustle of Broadway/Upper West Side; only a few minutes walk to Central Park, Riverside Park, Museum Mile.Right across the street from the 1, 2, 3 subway line; full-service doorman building.All the best supermarkets are nearby and too many famous stores and restaurants to mention;some open 24 hours.Only 15 minutes by subway to Times Square and the best of New York.I think it's the prettiest neighborhood in New York! Good for couples and solo adventurers.
space: The studio is about 500 s.f., or 46.5 m2.It is L-shaped, bright and well-lit with an eastern orientation. You will have use of a full modern kitchen, a living space that is well-appointed, with a large flat-screen TV, basic cable, access to Netflix, Wifi. The sofa opens into a comfortable queen-size bed.Very quiet building and neighbors.Plenty of closet and space. Washers and dryers in the basement.Gym room.

neighborhood_overview: This is the one and only Upper West Side, with some of the best restaurants, the greatest parks in the world, the greatest cultural centers and movie theaters.There is a constant flow of unique and interesting people living and streaming through the neighborhood.    Central Park is less than ten minutes away by walk, Lincoln Center is in the neighborhood, Columbia University and Morningside Heights just North of here.You are 15 minutes away by train from Times Square.
transit: The apartment is literally across the street from local and express subway lines (1,2 and 3) and a few blocks from other lines (A, B, C, D), as well as several buses.
access: This is a separate and fully available apartment.
interaction: I will be away from the neighborhood during your stay but I will be available by phone and we will be in contact prior and during your stay when need be. Key deliveries can be made by the building's 24-hour reception staff and they can address basic concerns.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States

reviews.comments:
Sadri's apartment is a great base for one or two people to visit New York. Apartment is compact but  well laid out with everything you need.
Perfect location with restaurants and express subway downtown.
Sadri a nice guy and communicated quickly and well.
Highly recommended
Sandra and Maurie,  Melbourne, Australia
Sadri's apartment was in a great location,  very clean, with a lovely appointed kitchen. Would highly recommend this apartment
